where you can get broad recognition for your expert knowledge (by effortlessly distributing the content you create via social media),
find new patients and grow your practice, and reduce your costs while improving the quality of care.
Get started in 3 simple steps:
Confirm your account:

1.Confirm your account details here:

Real photos help build credibility and trust with users.
2.Complete Your Registration
by Updating Your Profile and Answering three or more Questions
It's fast and simple to update your interactive Medical Home on HealthTap and be recognized by patients in your town and nationwide.
Getting started as a Medical Expert is easy: just post 3 or more short Answers (which can be as brief as a sentence or two – you can edit or delete them at any time)
then complete your registration by updating the information on your Medical Home - select "Medical Home" from your home page and add your personal information to the About section.
You have full control over everything you share on HealthTap and can use your insights in your
own blog, website, and in other publications. You can automatically syndicate your posts on other
social media platforms. Our staff would be happy to set up professional Facebook or Twitter
accounts for you (for free).

by adding simple Answers and Tips
Advance your online and social media reputation by sharing your answers and Tips on HealthTap.
For a limited time, our most prolific contributors can achieve Founding Expert status and be prominently featured on our founding experts page.
Additionally, to appear as a Featured (5+ answers), Notable (25+ answers), or Leading (50+ answers) Expert,
simply provide more quality responses to questions and add more Tips on HealthTap.
All Answers and Tips you post will link back to your Medical Home Page. You can broaden your visibility by contributing more content,
which will also help new patients find you. Your Medical Home can also serve as a valuable resource for your existing patients, before and between visits.
We're here to help

or call us at (650) 644-1833. Our medical and technical staff are standing by to help at anytime.

We know you’ve been waiting a while for an answer to your question, and we’d like to thank you for your patience. We just want to let you know that not all questions on HealthTap receive answers. A question is likely to go unanswered if it lacks detail, the question is unclear, or if it contains terms with which the doctors are not familiar. We are writing to let you know that your question is much more likely to receive a response if you improve it by editing or resubmitting it.
We encourage you to look at relevant information for your question and use it to improve your question. You’ll find an amazing amount of questions and existing answers on HealthTap.
See Similar Questions and discover related topics:
With our huge database of questions and health topics, chances are you’ll find something similar. We encourage you to look through similar questions to find the answer you’re looking for.
After you review similar content, we suggest you
to add enough detail to make it meaningful, answerable, and easy to understand. Please remember to only ask about one topic in your question, and double-check your spelling and grammar.
Thanks for editing your question! We know it will help us find you the answer you’re seeking.

We know you’re still waiting on an answer and want to thank you for your patience. Our doctors are still working overtime to answer the questions pouring in from across the globe. We really want to help you find the answer you’re looking for and we encourage you to take one of the following actions to improve your chance of finding a great answer from a top doctor:
Review Similar Content:

With our huge database of millions of questions and answers from leading doctors, chances are you’re likely to find similar questions that already have great answers from multiple doctors, that were peer reviewed by other doctors too!
See related topics »
Did the content on these pages answer your question?
Edit your question:

If you don’t find an answer you’re 100% happy with by looking at similar questions on HealthTap, feel free to edit and improve your question. Our doctors are able to select which questions to answer, and may skip questions that aren’t answerable, clear, and/or detailed. Ways to improve your question include: add enough detail to make it meaningful, answerable, and easy to understand; ask about just one topic in your question; and double-check your spelling and grammar.
Expedite for only $0.99:
If you’d like to get your question answered faster, you can also donate 99 cents to charity and we’ll give your questions a higher priority.
Thanks for asking!

As you know, our doctors are currently working through many great questions from millions of people everywhere. We really want to help you find the answer you’re looking for so we encourage you to take one of the following actions to get a great answer from a top doctor faster:

Reference Guide: How to Write a Great HealthTap Answer

Do not provide medical care through HealthTap. HealthTap is a website, not a doctor, and therefore is not a substitute for your face-to-face professional medical advice, diagnosis rendering, and treatment of disorders. Write your answers mainly to give information.
Too direct:
You have jock itch, so buy some OTC Lotrimin cream and use it twice a day for 2 weeks. Keep your groin dry, and your rash should be gone in a couple of weeks.
Much better:

Itchy, reddened, slightly flaky skin in the groin skin folds can be from jock itch or other causes. Jock itch (tinea cruris) is caused by a fungus germ, and is usually treated with over-the-counter Lotrimin AF cream or with prescription anti-fungal medication from a doctor.
Add a personal touch to your answer to humanize the online interaction.
Examples:
Include a hint of humor if appropriate; wish the member “good luck”, “have a great day”, or “hope you get well soon”; or add a comforting picture or image.

Make your answer long enough to be helpful to others, because thousands of people all over the world may read your answer. Answers of less than 4 words are bad answers (just imagine the member sitting, facing you, and only hearing 4 words from you).
Too brief:
Do another pregnancy test.
If a first over-the-counter (OTC) urine pregnancy test is negative, but a woman really feels that she is pregnant, she can do another OTC urine pregnancy test one week later.
Put some details in your answer. Details help members understand their problems.
Adequate:
Eat foods that have few calories.
One should eat foods that have few calories such as carrots, celery sticks, and iceberg lettuce; but use no salad dressing or only a bit of low-calorie dressing.
Consider adding a picture or other image to your answer, to emphasize your point, help explain a fact, or just make your answer more appealing.
Example:
Add a picture of an ambulance when informing a member that the usual recommendation, for people with the symptoms he asks about, is to go to an Emergency Room.
Use the most widely known drug name, or use both the brand and generic names, when talking about medications.
One may try acetaminophen but see the doctor if fever persists.
One may try Tylenol (acetaminophen) or Motrin/Advil (ibuprofen) if the fever is not high, but should see a doctor if fever goes higher or lasts more than 2 days.
Use good grammar and punctuation, reflecting the many years of a doctor's higher education.
Poor form:
A person can hurt their arms if you do too many reps too much weight or bad technique
A person can hurt his arm muscles by doing too many repetitions, using too much weight, or having poor weight-lifting techniques.
Don't assume every HealthTap member speaks English well or has a higher education. Explain long words and avoid medical abbreviations.
Not good:
The G.I. doc may order fecal occult blood x3 to screen for colon ca.
The gastroenterologist (stomach/intestines specialist) may order a stool test to check for traces of blood in the stool, on 3 separate days, to look for signs of colon cancer.

“Wonder how I'm getting all those subscriptions? Here are three pointers to help you. I don't have much sales experience, but I do love telling stories. Any good story has to answer three questions:

Quick guide to getting your questions answered on HealthTap
Be Easy to Understand

Questions must be in English, easy to understand, and about health or wellness topics. Common abbreviations are fine to use, but avoid unusual abbreviations. HealthTap experts are U.S.-licensed doctors and seldom answer questions about uniquely foreign medications, or about hospitals and procedures in other countries.
Ask Meaningful Questions

Questions must include enough detail to be meaningful and answerable. Vague questions that name a topic (for example, “I have a discharge”) without asking something specific are hard to answer. Try to mention whether the question is about a man or a woman, whether the topic relates to a certain age group, how long ago the symptoms started, and which parts of the body are affected.
Check Spelling of Words and Medicines

Doctors may not understand a question if it contains many misspelled words. Lab test results should not be just numbers, but should include the units of measurement (such as pounds or mg/24hr). If you mention a medication not available in the United States, be sure to include the generic name or the American brand name.
Stay Private
Do not include your name, names of other people, nor doctors’ names in the question.
If You’re a Minor, Get an Adult to Help
The doctors avoid answering questions from minors under the age of 18, so parents should ask questions for the teens and children.

trans-unit.source: Congratulations, you’ve been approved as a HealthTap Prime doctor.Welcome to the team!
trans-unit.target: Felicidades, has sido aprobado como un doctor de HealthTap Prime,¡Bienvenido al equipo!

trans-unit.source: Your start date has been deferred because we don’t have available shifts at the times you selected, or in the state(s) you practice in. We have simply experienced so much success that we are at capacity right now.However, we are thrilled that you are on board, and as soon as the opportunity arises, we will offer you shifts.Millions of patients around the world are seeking doctors with your expertise!
trans-unit.target: Tu fecha de inicio se aplazó porque no tenemos turnos disponibles en los tiempos que seleccionaste o en el(los) estado(s) en los que practicas. Simplemente hemos experimentado tanto éxito que que estamos a tope en capacidad por el momento.Sin embargo, estamos emocionados que estés a bordo, y tan pronto como la oportunidad se presente, te ofreceremos turnos.¡Millones de pacientes al rededor del mundo están buscan doctores con tu experiencia!

trans-unit.source: Indeed, if you like, you can start seeing patient's right away by making yourself "Available" on an ad-hoc basis to accept consults from any patients waiting in the queue when our shift doctors are busy seeing other patients.
trans-unit.target: De hecho, si así gustas, puedes empezar viendo pacientes de inmediato poniéndote como “Disponible” en una base ad-hoc para aceptar consultas de cualquier paciente esperando en fila cuando nuestros doctores en turno esten ocupados viendo otros pacientes.

trans-unit.source: And of course, you can always answer members’ questions, curate articles and research, create tips and checklists--and do all the other things that will raise your DocScore™ and make people smile and feel good.
trans-unit.target: Y por supuesto, siempre puedes contestar preguntas de miembros, curar artículos e investigaciones, crear consejos y listas de cotejo-- y hacer todas las otras cosas que incrementarán tu DocScore™ y hacer sonreir y sentir bien a la gente.

trans-unit.source: We’ll contact you when the situation changes.In the meantime, we recommend checking that your profile is up to date, and that it contains all your qualifications, accolades, and practice information, so that you achieve the highest DocScore™ possible.Virtual Consultants with higher DocScores™ take precedence when it comes to scheduling.Staying active in the Medical Expert Network and providing helpful answers to members’ questions that other doctors agree with will also help your DocScore.
trans-unit.target: Te contactaremos cuando la situación cambie.Mientras tanto, recomendamos revisar que tu perfil esté actualizado, y que contiene todas las calificaciones, galardones e información de práctica, para que puedas logras el DocScore™ más alto posible.Consultantes Virtuales con los puntajes más altos en DocScore™ toman prioridad al momento de agendar.Permanecer activo en el Medical Expert Network y proveer respuestas útiles a las preguntas de miembros que otros doctores aceptan, ayudará también a tu DocScore™.

trans-unit.source: We look forward to working with you!
trans-unit.target: ¡Estamos emocionados de trabajar contigo!
